verses.roman:
cāri-dike bhakta-aṅga kaila prakṣālana
śrāvaṇera megha yena kare variṣaṇa

synonyms: cāri-dike—all around; bhakta-aṅga—the bodies of the devotees; kaila—did; prakṣālana—washing; śrāvaṇera megha—exactly like a cloud in the month of Śrāvaṇa (July-August); yena—as if; kare variṣaṇa—pour.
translation: In this way Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu washed the bodies of all the devotees with the tears from His eyes. The tears poured like rains in the month of Śrāvaṇa.
